page.title: 07BURTON SALMON ROADS
page.content: We went around the area looking for signs and roads. We found 19 different kinds of signs. The oldest one was the mile stone which had the distances to Doncaster, Pontefract, York, and Tadcaster. The three most important roads running through our area are the A1 dual carriageway, which goes from London to Edinborough, the A162 Trunk Road and the lanes leading to Hillam and Burton Salmon. The A1 dual carriageway has, on average, 7,000 cars an hour. The A162 has about 300 cars an hour and the Hillam Road has only 50 cars an hour.
